name: Dr. V. Sindhu
title: Postdoctoral Researcher
bio: Dr. V. Sindhu is currently a Project Associate in the Mechanical Engineering Department at IIT Bhilai, bringing a strong interdisciplinary background to her work. She earned her Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Madras in 2020, following an M.E. in Mechatronics from Madras Institute of Technology (MIT) in 2013, and a B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering from SSN College of Engineering in 2011. Prior to her current role, Dr. Sindhu gained experience as a Project Officer in an ISRO-funded project at IIT Madras for eight months, contributing to Rapid prototyping area. Her research interests are centered around Mechatronic system design, Robotics, Reverse Engineering, and Implant modelling.

name: Ashish D
title: Research Assistant
bio: Ashish D is currently a Project Assistant in this group at IIT Bhilai, bringing strong technical expertise from his B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University. His interdisciplinary background spans automation, environmental sustainability, and innovative waste management solutions. He has demonstrated exceptional research capabilities through multiple funded projects and patent publications. Prior to his current role, Ashish gained extensive experience in urban development analysis, automation implementation, and environmental impact reduction projects. His research interests are centered around plasma technology applications, waste-to-energy systems, AI/ML development, automation in industrial processes, and sustainable engineering solutions.

contributions.description: Collected and analyzed comprehensive data for Indian 100 smart cities initiative contributing significantly to urban development projects and policy recommendations.
Implemented advanced automation solutions in garbage suction trucks, streamlining waste management processes and improving operational efficiency across multiple urban centers.

Working on cutting-edge carbon purification projects, developing innovative solutions to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability in industrial applications. Using Electrostatics and tribo-charging technology.

Working on SECL-funded research initiative involving regular site visits to coal mining facilities to evaluate water usage efficiency, analyze current water management systems, and develop innovative solutions for sustainable water utilization in mining operations.

name: Ajit Kumar Roy
title: Software Developer
bio: Ajit Kumar Roy is currently an undergraduate intern in the group. He is a final year B.Tech, CSE'26 student at CIT Kokrajhar. He is passionate about software development and has been actively involved in building web applications, contributing to open-source projects, and participating in national-level hackathons such as the Smart India Hackathon. His technical interests include full-stack development, UI/UX design, and exploring scalable backend architectures.

contributions.description: Designed and developed a full-stack web application for the Advanced Materials Development & Characterization Group at IIT Bhilai. The platform highlights the group's research focus, publications, lab facilities, team members, and ongoing projects, providing an engaging and informative online presence for the research community.
A mobile application that measures the angle at which the user is holding their phone to determine the angle of the users neck to give alerts to avoid TechNeck spine issue.

name: Priyam Kashyap Sharma
title: Former Research Assistant
bio: Mr. Priyam is now a PhD scholar in Mechanical Engineering at IIT Bombay with a strong background in high-entropy alloys, composite and bio materials, and sustainable engineering. He holds B.Tech degree from PTU and M.Tech degree from NERIST and has previously worked as a Research Assistant in this group. His research spans advanced materials, circular economy applications, surface engineering, and materials design for defense and aerospace. He actively collaborates with institutions like ISRO on interdisciplinary and funded research projects.
